description.value: The area of the venom pool is difficult terrain, and each creature moving through it takes [[/r 10[acid]]]{10 acid} for every square of its area that it moves into.

Trigger A creature moves through any square in the hazard's space

Effect The pool produces a 9th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Cloudkill]; (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|traits:death,necromancy,poison]) at its center. It then rolls initiative.

stealth.details: (legendary) to distinguish between the hazard and the oozes within it; @Check[type:perception|dc:0|traits:hazard,complex,environmental] to notice the pool

details.description: A shallow, foul-smelling puddle of toxic acid blocks a narrow hall (marked with a dotted line on the map), and poison bursts from it when disturbed.
details.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:40|name:Neutralize the acid|traits:hazard,complex,environmental] (master) or @Check[type:survival|dc:42|name:Neutralize the acid|traits:hazard,complex,environmental] (legendary) to neutralize the acid while within reach of it. Three successes using either skill (or a combination of both) destroys the hazard.
details.reset: The hazard ends after 1 minute, contracting to its original size and keeping still until disturbed again.
details.routine: (2 actions) The hazard uses its first action to spread 10 feet down the hallway in both directions. Once out of the hall, each side spreads in a random direction each round, but they don't go through doors. The hazard uses its second action to move the center of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Cloudkill] up to 20 feet in any direction to which any part of the pool has line of effect (normally, to encompass the greatest number of characters). If the cloudkill isn't present, it instead uses its second action to produce a new cloudkill, as Poison Puff.
